message.content:
{"id": "124610", "title": "Bug 124610 - Adding a filter on a boolean computed column causes an error", "description": "When adding a filter on a boolean computed column, an error is thrown.

The steps to reproduce the issue are as follows:", "OB": "When adding a filter on a boolean computed column, an error is thrown.", "EB": "When attempting to add a filter on a boolean computed column, the application throws an error.", "SR": "To reproduce the issue, follow these steps:
1. Create a new BIRT sample data source and dataset from the table "orders".
2. Create a computed column with the name "yes/no", type "any" (not boolean), and value "if(row[1]%2==0){true;}else{false;}".
3. Drag the dataset from the Data Explorer to the Layout.
4. Select the table and click on the Filters tab in the Property Editor.
5. Click the Add button.
6. Select "yes/no" as the Expression and "Is True" as the Operator.
7. Attempt to add the filter."}

origin.input_prompt:
Your role is a senior software engineer, you are very good at analyzing and writing bug reports.
It is possible that the bug report may lack sufficient details in the OB, EB, and SR sections.  In such cases, your task is to infer the appropriate details based on the context and supplement the bug report to ensure it contains clear and complete OB/EB/SR statements.  Also, improve the wording of these statements for clarity where possible.
To facilitate this process, please provide your responses in JSON format as follows:
{"id": "", "title": "", "description": "", "OB": "", "EB": "", "SR": ""}
origin.input_content:
<BUG REPORT>

Create a computed column with name="yes/no", type = any(no boolean for choose),value=if(row[1]%2==0){true;}else{false;}3. Drag the dataset from Data Explorer to Layout4. Select the table, click Filters tab in Property Editor.5. Click Add button.6. Select yes/no as Expression, Is True as Operator.7. '}
